_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The stationary source and regulated substances handled.



Tecumseh Poultry, LLC is a poultry processing facility located at 333 South Third Street in Tecumseh, NE. At our facility, anhydrous ammonia (cas #7664-41-7) is used as a refrigerant during processing and to maintain the desired air temperatures of our freezers and cooler rooms. Designed as a closed-loop, two-stage compression system, liquid ammonia is either pumped or circulated by pressure to the cooling evaporators. A mix of ammonia liquid and vapor returns to suction vessels where the liquid is separated from the vapor. Ammonia vapor is pulled from the suction vessels, compressed, and sent to rooftop condensers where it is cooled and condensed to a liquid to be used again by the evaporators. The maximum high-side system operating pressure is 175 psig but the highest pressure that the system normally operates at ranges between 125 to 150 psig. The maximum quantity of ammonia on-site is 15,000 lbs.



The general accidental release prevention program and the specific prevention steps.



Many safety features have been incorporated into the design and installation of the ammonia refrigeration system to protect the system and its components from a catastrophic failure and release of ammonia and to minimize the impact should an incident occur. Notable safety design features include:



1.    System operation and monitoring by programmable logic controllers (PLC). The PLCs control the operation of the ammonia refrigeration system including loading and unloading compressors to handle the load demands of the system, sequencing condenser fans and water pumps to maintain a safe high-side operating pressure and controlling the cooling and defrost cycles of area evaporators to maintain room temperatures. The PLCs also monitor the operating parameters of the system such as pressures, temperatures, and liquid levels and will either initiate an alarm or shut down the system (depending on the type of alarm) when any of the

parameters are out of range. 



2.    Each compressors' microprocessor uses the latest technology to ensure compressors operate within safe pressures and temperatures and are adequately lubricated. The microprocessors will shut down any compressor that operates outside of safe limits. 



3.    Emergency ventilation system installed in the engine room that meets or exceeds all applicable codes. The emergency ventilation system is automatically turned on by ammonia detectors installed inside the engine room or they can be manually started using switches located outside of the engine room.



4.    Automatic fire sprinkler systems have been installed throughout the facility.  



In addition to all of the safety features incorporated into the design of the system, Tecumseh Poultry, LLC complies with the following regulations, codes and guidelines: 



OSHA Process Safety Management regulation 1910.119

ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 15-2001

ANSI/IIAR 2-1999

ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Codes

ANSI B31.3 Piping Code

IIAR industry guidelines for safety and good engineering practices

NFPA guidelines for fire protection equipment



Tecumseh Poultry, LLC has also established a maintenance program to ensure that routine and preventive maintenance tasks, inspections and tests are conducted to maintain the ongoing mechanical integrity of the ammonia refrigeration system and safety systems. In addition, the facility has established initial and refresher training requirements for ammonia refrigeration operators and mechanics as well as awareness training for all facility employees.



The emergency response program.



All facility employees are trained on the hazards of ammonia and how to recognize and report accidental releases. They are also trained on evacuation procedures, where to go and what to do once they have evacuated the building. Tecumseh Poultry, LLC has trained refrigeration operators to handle small or incidental ammonia releases. Emergency response efforts have been coord

inated with the Tecumseh volunteer Fire Department and the Johnson County LEPC. Facility personnel will evaluate and respond to all ammonia releases that are within their training, capability and resources. If facility personnel cannot safely control and mitigate the release, or the incident would affect the public or the environment, the facility will notify the Tecumseh Police and Fire Departments for assistance.



Five-year accident history.



There have been no reportable accidents within the past five years.



Planned or applied changes to improve safety.



Tecumseh Poultry, LLC has installed additional NH3 detectors to improve detection ability on the roof of the plant and have them tied in to air make-up units in the plant, programed to shut down if a detectors activate.  Upgrades were also made to the ammonia refrigeration control system with a Logix Controls Clarity Software Program and redundant control station in case the primary control station computer or monitor fail. New Logix system also allows for remote accessibility and automatic communications and notifications by the system to members of the motive power staff and management team by e-mail, text message or phone call. The display allows for full view of all components of the refrigeration system and how each is performing while allowing normal adjustments to be made to fine tune performance of the refrigeration system and its components.
